step1.sentence: At the charity gala, I got to rub shoulders with some of the most influential people in the tech industry.

step2.story: Maya had never expected her internship to lead anywhere special. But on her very first week, she found herself rubbing shoulders with top executives at a company retreat. By the end of the month, she had built connections that would shape her entire career.

step3.story: Daniel grew up in a small town where everyone knew each other by name. When he moved to New York to study film, the scale of the city overwhelmed him. One evening, a classmate dragged him to an indie film screening in Brooklyn. To his amazement, he ended up rubbing shoulders with award-winning directors and producers who genuinely wanted to hear his ideas. That single night shifted his perspective entirely. He realized that opportunity wasn't about where you came from — it was about showing up and being ready.

meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 유명하거나 영향력 있는 사람들과 어울리거나 교류하는 것을 의미합니다. 주로 사교 모임이나 특별한 자리에서 저명인사들과 함께하는 상황에 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 사람들이 붐비는 사교 모임에서 서로 어깨가 닿을 정도로 가까이 서 있는 모습에서 유래한 표현입니다. 18세기경부터 영어에서 사용되기 시작했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 만나는 것이 아니라, 보통 자신보다 사회적 지위가 높거나 유명한 사람들과 같은 공간에서 교류한다는 뉘앙스가 있습니다. 긍정적인 느낌으로 많이 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She rubbed shoulders with celebrities at the film premiere.
